customer_addr:
E 16231 St Johns Ave
Hillsboro, WI 54634

citations.narrative:
A 3-week old Teddy was observed to be sticking it's head through the front enclosure bars. I asked the licensee if any
pups have fallen through the front enclosure bars and he stated that one puppy fell through the bars yesterday. It was not
injured. Puppies falling through the front bars of the enclosure could injure themselves on the fall. They could also get
their heads stuck and get injured that way. The licensee must ensure the primary enclosure is designed and constructed
of suitable materials to ensure that no puppies are able to fall through or stick their heads through the front bars of the
enclosure. Correct by 7/27/23.

The licensee has purchased all his adult dogs from other breeders within the past year. He is not sure if they are currently
up to date on their distemper and parvo vaccines. He was unable to provide any documentation showing his adults are up
to date on their distemper and parvo vaccines. Not having proper documentation showing the dogs are up to date on their
parvo and distemper vaccines doesn't ensure the dogs are adequately protected against these diseases. The licensee
must either track down the dogs' vaccine records or he must get all the adult dogs current on their distemper and parvo
vaccines and be able to make those records available at future inspections. Correct by 8/27/23.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
End of report.
Additional Inspectors:
Jennifer Walker, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
3.6(a)(2)(iii) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
A 3-week old Teddy was observed to be sticking it's head through the front enclosure bars. I asked the licensee if any 
pups have fallen through the front enclosure bars and he stated that one puppy fell through the bars yesterday. It was not 
injured. Puppies falling through the front bars of the enclosure could injure themselves on the fall. They could also get 
their heads stuck and get injured that way. The licensee must ensure the primary enclosure is designed and constructed 
of suitable materials to ensure that no puppies are able to fall through or stick their heads through the front bars of the 
enclosure. Correct by 7/27/23. 
3.13(b)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The licensee has purchased all his adult dogs from other breeders within the past year. He is not sure if they are currently 
up to date on their distemper and parvo vaccines. He was unable to provide any documentation showing his adults are up 
to date on their distemper and parvo vaccines. Not having proper documentation showing the dogs are up to date on their 
parvo and distemper vaccines doesn't ensure the dogs are adequately protected against these diseases. The licensee 
must either track down the dogs' vaccine records or he must get all the adult dogs current on their distemper and parvo 
vaccines and be able to make those records available at future inspections. Correct by 8/27/23. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
End of report. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
Jennifer Walker, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
